intro: Antidesma agusanense, commonly known as the Agusan antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in lowland to montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
